content.prompt: Which of the following biotechnology approaches could be used to identify ferritin mRNA in a sample of total cellular RNA?

choices.label: RNA samples could be directly cloned into a DNA plasmid, grown in bacteria, and tested for the ability to bind iron.
RNA samples could be separated by size using agarose gel electrophoresis and incubated with labeled single-stranded DNA molecules that are complementary to the ferritin mRNA.
RNA samples could be converted to protein and subsequently cut with a restriction endonuclease that recognizes DNA sequences.
RNA samples could be examined under a high-power microscope to visually identify the ferritin mRNA.
